intro: Sponia tetrandra, commonly known as the four-thread sponia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a mild, spicy scent. Sponia tetrandra is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
